channel.title: [Class Suggestion] The Locksmith / The Picklock (Replacement for Court Wizard / Sage)
channel.description:
#

I am proposing this class to replace the Court Wizard / Sage. My main goal in making this class was to stick close enough to the current CW so that the game's balance isn't too significantly impacted while still adding enough changes to make the class more engaging to play.

The Locksmith (Class type: Support)

>

Passives:

None

>

Day Ability:

Skeleton Key: Selected player is guaranteed to visit their target tonight. (3 uses)

>

Night Abilities:

Reinforce Lock: Prevent all players who are not Blue Dragon from visiting the target. [Cannot target the same player two nights in a row] (Infinite uses) (Notifies player when ability successful blocks someone)

Swap Locks: Cause all players targeting one of your targets to target the other. Bypasses redirection immunity (3 uses)


The Picklock (Class type: Support)

>

Passives:

None

>

Day Ability:

Pickpocket: Prevent all players that are not Unseen from visiting the target tonight. (2 uses)

>

Night Abilities:

Plant Evidence: Make target appear suspicious to Investigative classes. (Infinite uses)

Edit: As RHCube pointed out, this is basically just a worse version of Aristocrat's Intrigue. Maybe instead this ability could be the same as the Scorned's Disguise, changing the players class if he is executed the next day.

Swap Locks: Cause all players targeting one of your targets to target the other. Bypasses redirection immunity (3 uses)


Comments:

The Locksmith stays close to the CW in many important ways. He keeps CW's swap, and between Skeleton Key and Reinforce, the Locksmith can perform many of the same functions as CW. Namely, where CW would empower a phys to make sure he was able to heal his target, the Locksmith can use Skeleton Key on the phys during the day. Also, where the CW would use Clear Mind on an outted investigative class to stop a conversion, the Locksmith would use Reinforce Lock.

I think that replacing Empower + Clear Mind with Reinforce Locks + Skeleton Key will make this class more enjoyable to play than the current CW. For one, Empower is not a very intuitive ability since it has a different effect on each class type. Even after playing the CW many many times, I still have to check back to remember what it does for each class. Reinforce is much more straightforward.

Also, on the rare occasion that Empower does aid the target, it's usually not very satisfying since you don't know whether you just helped the phys heal their target or helped the reaper reap the prince. With Reinforce, you can be much more confident that you had a positive impact on the BD when your ability is successful. There is still a possibility that the ability will be counterproductive (e.g. preventing an alch from truthing an unseen; preventing the NK from killing assassin; preventing pretender from blood testing the MM; etc.) but it will still yield positive results much more frequently than Empower does.

The Picklock also stays fairly close to Sage, keeping the swap and the ability to "firewall" a target. The main difference as far as the firewall is concerned is that it is now a day ability (Pickpocket). This means that the first night the Locksmith is converted, he doesn't have the benefit of talking to the other unseen to pick a valuable firewall target. This is especially important now that Mastermind has Little Birds, I think. However, if all unseen are able to survive long enough, then they will be able to confer to pick a Pickpocket target, but this will require a little more luck and cooperation than it does for the Sage. I think Frame is also a good addition here since it is a fun, low-impact ability that works well with the class's lore.

Let me know what you think.

item.title: [Class Suggestion] The Locksmith / The Picklock (Replacement for Court Wizard / Sage)
item.dc:creator: VladTheImpaler
item.description:
Mercenary_Central:

I think it’s a good start, but preventing EVERYONE as the picklock during the day seems a little op in my opinion

My thinking was that this would function as a slightly less powerful firewall. It does the same thing as firewall, but is weaker because the Picklock isn’t able to talk with other unseen the night he’s converted to figure out who’s Prince or whatever. This means if MM knows who prince is and Locksmith is converted N3, then MM, assa, and Picklock must all survive until D5 in order for the ability to be used on prince.

Of course, if such a powerful day ability was added, I think the power of the night abilities would probably have to be lower to compensate.

Read full topic

item.title: [Class Suggestion] The Locksmith / The Picklock (Replacement for Court Wizard / Sage)
item.dc:creator: VladTheImpaler
item.description:
NuclearBurrito:

Sure but make it VERY limited use (2 at most. Probably 1)

Yes I would agree to make it only one use. It would virtually confirm the MM as BD investigative if played right, so I don’t think unseen deserves a second shot at it if they fail the first one.

NuclearBurrito:

I’ve always thought that kind of ability would work better on illusionist in particular instead of blur

I would certainly make sense on illusionist as well. However, illusionist already has mindwarp, which is an extremely powerful ability on its own. Adding disguise as well might make illusionist OP. Also, if Locksmith/Picklock were implimented, the disguise ability would make sense lore-wise for picklock as he can break into the players room and plant evidence to make them look like anything.

NuclearBurrito:

oh yeah. Alternatively just keep Picklock as a reskinned Sage with no mechanical difference

Definitely could work. Especially because I feel like no one is really dissatisfied with Sage itself, just CW.

item.title: [Class Suggestion] The Locksmith / The Picklock (Replacement for Court Wizard / Sage)
item.dc:creator: RHCube
item.description:
VladTheImpaler:

My main reasoning for not blocking BD was that I felt that otherwise would be mostly counterproductive.

And there’s nothing wrong with that. Non-investigative abilities should have risk to them.

VladTheImpaler:

Good point. Maybe it could instead perform the same function as the scorned’s Disguise ability. This would certainly be more powerful, especially with a MM claiming an investigative class.

Could work.

Firelitten:

The drawback is it isn’t confirmable

Sometimes confirmable abilities are needed to prevent a class from being overpowered(like with this. It would be OP if it only prevented non-BD)

Firelitten:

Just make it able to prevent all visitors to target and able to target the unseen

If it was able to target unseen than it would be a better version of enforcer’s protection.

Firelitten:

Except this alch could be a lie, the goal of unconfirmable classes is to make sure BD can’t find it confirmable

That’s actually another reason why I would prefer having skeleton key as a night ability, it’s not overpowered and not confirmable.

item.title: [Class Suggestion] The Locksmith / The Picklock (Replacement for Court Wizard / Sage)
item.dc:creator: VladTheImpaler
item.description:
Firelitten:

The drawback is it isn’t confirmable

It’s actually slightly more confirmable than the current CW. Swap Locks is identical to Tornado, which is the main confirmation for CWs, and Reinforce Locks could technically be confirmed by an outted alch since it blocks both neuts and evils.

Firelitten:

Just make it able to prevent all visitors to target and able to target the unseen

Yes this is definitely a possibility. As I said to RHCube above, I lean towards blocking only evils and neuts so that the ability is more useful for BD and thus would make the class more enjoyable, but I’m sure I haven’t thought through all the implications of that and it would certainly shift the game’s balance in the BD’s direction somewhat.

item.title: [Class Suggestion] The Locksmith / The Picklock (Replacement for Court Wizard / Sage)
item.dc:creator: VladTheImpaler
item.description:
RHCube:

BD shouldn’t have omniscient abilities. I would be fine with this if it just prevented all players from targeting your target.

I definitely considered this. My main reasoning for not blocking BD was that I felt that otherwise would be mostly counterproductive. Blocking Neuts and Evils only wouldn’t necessarily provide the Locksmith with any information regarding the identity of the prevented evils.

RHCube:

Just make this a night ability with unlimited uses.

I feel this would be similar to the CW’s empower in that it’s technically useful under limited circumstances but extremely boring and unsatisfying. I think it’s better suited to a day ability since it’s pretty limited in its utility.

RHCube:

This is just a worse intrigue.

Good point. Maybe it could instead perform the same function as the scorned’s Disguise ability. This would certainly be more powerful, especially with a MM claiming an investigative class.

RHCube:

This should have unlimited uses.

I just copy and pasted this from the current CW/Sage where Tornado is limited to three. I think that making this an unlimited ability would cause a lot of unnecessary mayhem.

Read full topic
